meanings.definition: A person who despises or looks down on someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The despiser in the group always made fun of others.
meanings.sent2: She was known as a despiser because she never had a kind word for anyone.
meanings.sent3: The despiser at the party made everyone feel uncomfortable with their rude comments.
meanings.sent4: His sister's cat was a despiser of all the new toys she brought home.
meanings.sent5: The despiser's sneer could be seen from across the room, making everyone uneasy.

meanings.definition: To regard with contempt or scorn.
meanings.sent1: He would despiser anyone who didn't agree with his opinions.
meanings.sent2: She would often despiser her classmates for no reason.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to despiser the new brand of food his owner bought.
meanings.sent4: The old man would despiser the modern technology, preferring his old ways.
meanings.sent5: The villain's plan was to despiser the hero and ruin his reputation.
